TEXT: The applicant [ Mr PERSON ] is a NORP national who lives in GPE .
He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE and DATE the GPE region was hit by torrential rains which produced a sudden rise in LOC and caused the PERSON dam to burst and then collapse .

Land was flooded in CARDINAL municipalities as a result of the dam collapsing and the water from it pouring into the PERSON . CARDINAL people died , many properties and much farmland were damaged and CARDINAL people were affected by the disaster . The scale of it gave rise to very strong public feeling and wide reporting in the media .
At the time of the disaster the applicant was an engineer at the dam .
On DATE PERSON ( GPE ) investigating judge no . CARDINAL started a criminal investigation .
In an order of DATE he charged the applicant and GPE , another engineer who worked at the dam , with serious negligence .

On DATE those victims of the disaster who had together joined the proceedings as a single civil party applied for CARDINAL other engineers at the dam , ORG and PERSON , to be charged with the same offence . In an order of CARDINAL DATE ORG charged ORG and PERSON with serious negligence . The CARDINAL engineers and counsel representing the government lodged an appeal ( recurso de súplica ) against that decision . Their appeal was dismissed on DATE .

The trial began on CARDINAL DATE . The civil party sought to have a further engineer at the dam , PERSON , likewise charged with the same offence . In an order of DATE the FAC charged LOC .- T.M. with very serious negligence . J.S .- T.M. lodged a súplica appeal against that decision . His appeal was dismissed on DATE . The trial was then adjourned to CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE J.S .- T.M. lodged a criminal complaint against CARDINAL of the ORG judges for abuse of office . On DATE the ORG ruled that there were no grounds for that complaint . J.S .- T.M. lodged a súplica appeal against that ruling . His appeal was dismissed on CARDINAL DATE . On a further appeal , ORG upheld the original ruling .
Subsequently , on DATE and DATE , DATE .- T.M. challenged the same CARDINAL judges in LOC , but was unsuccessful . He lodged an appeal ( recurso de amparo ) with ORG , which dismissed it on DATE .
The trial was held at FAC between DATE and DATE . On DATE the court acquitted the applicant , GPE and ORG , but sentenced PERSON and PERSON to DATE imprisonment and to fines for serious negligence .

PERSON and DATE appealed on points of law to ORG , arguing that the trial court ’s judgment should be declared a nullity on the ground that the proceedings had been flawed . In a judgment of DATE ORG declared that the order in respect of ORG and PERSON was void and that the trial was a nullity on the ground that one of the Valencia ORG judges had been biased . It ordered the proceedings to be resumed expeditiously .
In a decision ( auto ) of DATE ORG ordered the trial to begin . Hearings were held in open court DATE and DATE .

Subsequently , in a decision of DATE , ORG adjourned the date for lodging final written submissions in order to allow other victims of the disaster to bring proceedings . The defendants and the victims lodged súplica appeals ( CARDINAL in all ) against that decision . In a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the appeals and upheld the decision of DATE .

On DATE counsel representing the government lodged an amparo appeal against those CARDINAL decisions . Subsequently the applicant himself joined that appeal . ORG , in a decision of CARDINAL DATE , reversed the decisions , found that the proceedings had been lengthy and ordered the trial to begin .
Hearings were held from DATE to DATE .
In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG acquitted all the defendants .

The public prosecutor ’s office and the civil party appealed on points of law to ORG , which , in a judgment of DATE , served on DATE , set aside the ORG judgment and sentenced the applicant to DATE imprisonment and to fines for negligence under LAW . It also ordered the ORG to pay the damages if the applicant was insolvent .

The applicant then lodged an amparo appeal with ORG in which he complained , inter alia , of the length of the proceedings . His appeal was dismissed in a decision of DATE , which was served on DATE , on the grounds that the fundamental right on which he relied had not been raised earlier and that the appeal did not raise a constitutional issue . ORG stated that the applicant had failed to comply with section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(c ) of LAW in that he had not submitted his complaint to ORG when it had heard the appeal on points of law ; he should in any event have raised it at an earlier stage of the proceedings when formal note could have been taken of the excessive length of the proceedings , and not DATE after the violation had occurred and after the authority responsible for the lengthy proceedings had taken steps to expedite them . ORG also pointed out that it had already addressed that ground of appeal and granted relief on an earlier amparo appeal .
“ Everyone is entitled … to a public trial without undue delays … ”
“ Losses incurred as a result of judicial errors or a malfunctioning of the administration of justice shall be compensated by the ORG , in accordance with the law . ”

“ CARDINAL . Anyone who incurs a loss as a result of a judicial error or a malfunctioning of the judicial system shall be compensated by the ORG , other than in cases of force majeure , in accordance with the provisions of this Part .
CARDINAL . NORP The alleged loss must in any event actually have occurred and be quantifiable in monetary terms and must directly affect either an individual or a group of individuals . ”
“ In the event of a judicial error or a malfunctioning of the judicial system , the complainant shall submit his claim for compensation to ORG .

The claim shall be examined in accordance with the provisions governing the ORG ’s financial liability . An appeal shall lie to the administrative courts against the decision of ORG . The right to compensation shall lapse DATE after it could first have been exercised . ”

“ CARDINAL . An amparo appeal in respect of a violation of rights and guarantees capable of constitutional protection … does not lie unless … the violation in question has been formally alleged in the proceedings in question as soon as possible after it has occurred .
